items.title: Lampard en 'stoomwals' Coventry City kunnen zich vast opmaken voor Premier League
items.summary: Frank Lampard is hard op weg naar de Premier League met zijn Coventry City. De 106-voudig international van Engeland is bezig aan een zeer succesvol seizoen in het Championship. Hij kan dan ook fraaie cijfers overleggen.

items.title: Pitch imperfect: Was MCG surface fit for Test cricket after 'farcical' match?

items.title: Klaassen dart tegen ex-wereldkampioen Price: 'Wilde een koptelefoon opzetten'
items.summary: Dat Wout Weghorst en Davy Klaassen een aardig balletje kunnen trappen, is bekend. Maar kan het Ajax-duo ook een beetje darten? Dat mochten Weghorst en Klaassen laten zien tijdens de Ajax Darts Challenge, waaraan ook Ross Smith en oud-wereldkampioen Gerwyn Price meededen.

items.title: VI Live: Engelse titelkandidaten in actie op volle voetbalzaterdag
items.summary: Goedendag en welkom in de VI Live van zaterdag 27 december. Hopelijk had u een fijne kerstperiode, en bent u klaar voor een fraaie dag vol voetbal. In dit blog hoeft u niks te missen van mooie affiches in onder meer Itali√´, Engeland en Marokko.

items.title: Frank: We're in a transition phase - but we can create something very magical
items.summary: "I think we are in a transition phase, because yes, we are a Champions League club, but are we a Champions League club? We only qualified because we won the Europa League. We didn't qualify because we were one of the four or five best clubs in the Premier League last season. We finished 17th."

items.title: Ashes Verdict: Athers and Nas on England's 'extraordinary victory'
items.summary: Nasser Hussain and Michael Atherton reflect on England's 'extraordinary victory' over Australia, which ends England 18-Test winless streak in Australia.

items.title: I was there: England‚Äôs Euro 2025 glory was a surreal, almost psychedelic blur
items.summary: Sarina Wiegman‚Äôs champions took supporters on the most thrilling and nail-biting ride in Switzerland that was in many ways even more enjoyable to cover than their 2022 triumph Surreal. Utterly surreal. A home Euros in 2022 had provided wave after wave of emotion, England‚Äôs win at Wembley the culmination of decades of growth, setbacks, fight and deep longing. Everyone sang from the same hymn sheet for that maiden Euros win: the written press, broadcasters, fans, sponsors, Football Association, players and Sarina Wiegman and her staff. There were tears ‚Äì lots. Having begun covering women‚Äôs football for the Guardian via a weekly column before the 2017 Euros, then gone full-time before the 2019 World Cup, I felt as if I had lived that progression, journeyed with them, contributed, in some small way, to that growth. The 2025 edition was different, surreal, an almost psychedelic experience. In many ways better than 2022. This was England‚Äôs first major tournament win ‚Äì male or female ‚Äì away from home. Expectations were high but injuries, retirements and inconsistent performances and results had made most aware that a title defence wouldn‚Äôt be a procession. That made it all the more magnificent. Continue reading...

items.title: Morocco no longer continental pariah as Afcon showcases its global standing
items.summary: Country pulled out of hosting 2015 tournament but has since become central figure within world football It is hard to conceive that Morocco, now the nerve centre for staging Africa‚Äôs marquee football events, was a continental pariah 10 years ago. Abruptly pulling out of hosting the 2015 Africa Cup of Nations, over fears it would lead to the spread of the Ebola virus in the kingdom, forced the Confederation of African Football to move the tournament to Equatorial Guinea, with less than 90 days to prepare for its staging. Continue reading...

items.title: The best wonderkids outside big five leagues
items.summary: There are plenty of wonderkids catching the eye outside of Europe's big-five leagues - BBC Sport takes a look at the top 10 as ranked by the CIES Football Observatory research group.

items.title: England win first Test in Australia in 15 years after thrilling two-dayer at MCG
items.summary: England avoided any danger of an Ashes whitewash after ending an 18-Test and 15-year winless streak in Australia with a two-day victory in a remarkable match at Melbourne to cut their hosts' lead to 3-1 with one game to go.

items.title: How Guardiola made Man City title contenders again - tactical analysis
items.summary: After their Premier League domination came to an abrupt end last season, how has Pep Guardiola changed things tactically to bring about Manchester City's recent revival?

items.title: Makeshift Man United scrap to win over Newcastle, offering hope for rough stretch ahead
items.summary: Man United's win over Newcastle on Boxing Day may be Ruben Amorim's most satisfying yet as they overcame a depleted squad.

items.title: MCG madness! How England ended long wait for Test win in Australia
Amorim hails 'spirit' of depleted Man Utd in win
items.summary: Manchester United boss Ruben Amorim lauded his team's spirit and togetherness after a depleted squad beat Newcastle on Friday.

items.title: Wrexham's Moore delighted with brace vs. ex-club
items.summary: Kieffer Moore was pleased to silence the Sheffield United fans after his double inspired a superb Wrexham fightback on Boxing Day.

items.title: Morocco's historic winning streak snapped by Mali
items.summary: Morocco and Mali played to a 1-1 draw on Friday in their second AFCON Group A match, with both sides converting penalties awarded after VAR interventions.
